definitions.definition: (physical) A solid object in the shape of a circle.
(physical) A group of objects arranged in a circle.
A piece of food in the shape of a ring.
definitions.example: onion rings

definitions.definition: A place where some sports or exhibitions take place; notably a circular or comparable arena, such as a boxing ring or a circus ring; hence the field of a political contest.
An exclusive group of people, usually involving some unethical or illegal practices.
definitions.example: a crime ring; a prostitution ring; a bidding ring (at an auction sale)

definitions.definition: A group of atoms linked by bonds to form a closed chain in a molecule.
definitions.example: a benzene ring

definitions.definition: A planar geometrical figure included between two concentric circles.
A diacritical mark in the shape of a hollow circle placed above or under the letter; a kroužek.
An old English measure of corn equal to the coomb or half a quarter.
A hierarchical level of privilege in a computer system, usually at hardware level, used to protect data and functionality (also protection ring).
Either of the pair of clamps used to hold a telescopic sight to a rifle.
The twenty-fifth Lenormand card.
To enclose or surround.
definitions.example: The inner city was ringed with dingy industrial areas.

definitions.definition: To make an incision around; to girdle.
definitions.example: They ringed the trees to make the clearing easier next year.

definitions.definition: To attach a ring to, especially for identification.
definitions.example: We managed to ring 22 birds this morning.

definitions.definition: To surround or fit with a ring, or as if with a ring.
definitions.example: to ring a pig’s snout

definitions.definition: To rise in the air spirally.
To steal and change the identity of (cars) in order to resell them.
The resonant sound of a bell, or a sound resembling it.
definitions.example: The church bell's ring could be heard the length of the valley.

definitions.definition: A pleasant or correct sound.
definitions.example: The name has a nice ring to it.

definitions.definition: A sound or appearance that is characteristic of something.
definitions.example: Her statements in court had a ring of falsehood.

definitions.definition: A telephone call.
definitions.example: I’ll give you a ring when the plane lands.

definitions.definition: Any loud sound; the sound of numerous voices; a sound continued, repeated, or reverberated.
A chime, or set of bells harmonically tuned.
definitions.example: St Mary's has a ring of eight bells.

definitions.definition: Of a bell, etc., to produce a resonant sound.
definitions.example: The bells were ringing in the town.

definitions.definition: To make (a bell, etc.) produce a resonant sound.
definitions.example: The deliveryman rang the doorbell to drop off a parcel.

definitions.definition: To produce (a sound) by ringing.
definitions.example: They rang a Christmas carol on their handbells.

definitions.definition: To produce the sound of a bell or a similar sound.
definitions.example: Whose mobile phone is ringing?

definitions.definition: Of something spoken or written, to appear to be, to seem, to sound.
definitions.example: That does not ring true.

definitions.definition: To telephone (someone).
definitions.example: I will ring you when we arrive.

definitions.definition: To resound, reverberate, echo.
To produce music with bells.
To repeat often, loudly, or earnestly.

An algebraic structure which consists of a set with two binary operations: an additive operation and a multiplicative operation, such that the set is an abelian group under the additive operation, a monoid under the multiplicative operation, and such that the multiplicative operation is distributive with respect to the additive operation.
definitions.example: The set of integers, \mathbb{Z}, is the prototypical ring.

definitions.definition: An algebraic structure as above, but only required to be a semigroup under the multiplicative operation, that is, there need not be a multiplicative identity element.
definitions.example: The definition of ring without unity allows, for instance, the set 2\mathbb{Z} of even integers to be a ring.
